benchmark_details.name: MMTU (Massive Multi-task Table Understanding)
benchmark_details.overview: MMTU is a large-scale benchmark comprising 30,647 questions across 25 real-world table tasks, designed to evaluate models' ability to understand, reason, and manipulate real tables at the expert-level.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To comprehensively evaluate models' ability in complex table-related tasks faced by professional users.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: A limitation of our benchmark is how our tasks are sampled and selected, which may introduce biases.

data.source: Collected from 52 diverse datasets focusing on real-world challenges in table tasks.
data.annotation: Expert-labeled based on decades of computer science research.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparisons between model predictions and ground-truth answers.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates a better model performance on complex table tasks.
methodology.validation: Final evaluation includes manual review and verification by domain experts.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of demographic factors related to output performance is not explicitly discussed.
harm: Potential inaccuracies in output due to model biases.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data selection and content review processes are implemented to minimize privacy concerns.
